content.label: The game is wonderful, almost as terrifying as it is beautiful

title.label: Been with this game for years but...

content.label: So I‚Äôve been with Badland since I was a kid and I love it so much, now I know you get this a lot but PLEASE make a level editor. When it first came out for 1 I was super excited and got it the second it came out, and I just came back to this game and found you you made a second game so I got it, played the first world, then got disappointed from the lack of one. Oh and also it might be good for you guys to leave 3D controls off, cause I was super confused when I first started up, and so was a lot of people apparently. I will pay SO MUCH for a level editor.

title.label: I want, I need, I can live with it.

content.label:
Ok so I‚Äôve played this game for a looonnnggg time but... remember the first one? Back then they released a level editor and I was so happy! Sooooo then the next part has been released. So I start playing the game, it was great! But after months I just realized there‚Äôs no level editor. So I thought ‚Äúoh I guess we just have to wait for a bit.‚Äù But I was so wrong... Now I was sad. :(
What‚Äôs even more sad one of the people in the first one released a level explaining it will not happen. And someone just give you a idea. I heard of the camera problem... I think you said: ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt know how the camera should work‚Äù or something like that. It‚Äôs easy! Let me tell you. Now what you can do is add camera points. Now you can connect the points by the wires thingy and there. Now I know that will take you for a wile. But it will have more content now. The first one is popular because the level editor. If you do the same then everyone will be happy and excited. I think I will hear everyone screaming of happiness because of you. And you can make 2020 better, well something like 2021. So basically I just want a level editor, it felt like it‚Äôs missing from the game. So pleeaaassee? ‚ÄúMore likely not‚Äù -someone in 2020
This game is terrific, but addicting. Some of the levels are hard, but trying and trying again is part of the appeal.

The graphics are absolutely wonderful! The gameplay is super fun, the new power ups and obstacles are amazing! I love how you can go both ways, the only reason I give it four stars is because I miss the coop from the first one, but understand why it can‚Äôt have it because it goes both ways. Everything else is awesome, great game overall and would highly recommend. The price is well, well, worth it!

While I do love the entire BADLAND series. Two just seems a lot like one. Yes there are different things and actions you can take I just felt like there could have been more. Especially since when I originally started playing any of the badland‚Äôs it was totally free. I don‚Äôt feel like you should have started charging for 1, fine for 2 since it‚Äôs always been .99 cents. But you shouldn‚Äôt charge people for something that was once free. And since you charge the .99 cents for badlands 2 which I gladly paid bc I love your games I just felt like there could have been more to the game is all. Maybe some small 3-D actions or modes and possibly a bit of a storyline to the game or clones. I‚Äôm not sure just something lol. In closing, the game is definitely worth the 99 cents and it‚Äôs very fun and there‚Äôs a lot of the original fun from badlands 2. I only gave it 3 stars bc I felt like there could have been more
This is a fun game. It‚Äôs super hard at times as well but rewarding. Occasionally I have failure of controls to respond but that could well be my device and not the game.

Why isn‚Äôt there a tutorial? Maybe my phone has a problem, but moving the character isn‚Äôt intuitive and I can‚Äôt figure out how to make it go where I want. If there was some sort of how-to section I could then figure out if it‚Äôs me or just glitches in the phone that‚Äôs the problem. I got it because the graphics are beautiful but I can‚Äôt even get in to entry level play, which is frustrating.
The first was much better I liked the first one so I thought I would get this one I was disappointed

title.label: Great, would be better with a  level editor.

content.label:
I have the first and second BADLAND games. I love this game, and it was worth the money, but I would like Frogmind to put a level editor (and an Eternal Day) in BADLAND 2.

Thank you for reading this review.

title.label: Great atmosphere and mechanics with no micro transactions!

content.label:
If you are a fan of Playdead‚Äôs INSIDE or LIMBO you will love this game. Very similar atmosphere and side-scrolling mechanics. Gameplay is a mix of puzzle and super-meat boy. 

I was so glad to see no advertisements or micro transactions in the game: the number of levels and polish makes it completely worth the upfront cost.

The touch system in this is un usable. Feels like u programmed it for force touch which is horrible and non responsive. After playing original for hours. I cant stand more than 5 minutes of smashing my phone in order to move. Sorry but the sequel is a bust. Nice try with going left but it doesnt work on forced movement games. Endless movers with screen based deaths should always be one way. Loved one, dislike 2, and I wont buy a badland 3. Sorry badland 2 is worse.
I wonder if there will be more levels
Ridiculously bad controls... impossible to control the weird flappy thing. How is this fun?

games where you die over and over again and keep repeating it until you finally beat the level, then you‚Äôll love this game. Not my cup of tea. I don‚Äôt mind problem solving if it takes me two or three tries to get through, but this is the type of game that requires you to die a million times by way of trial and error just so you know where the obstacles are and what they do. 

I still give it three stars for the nice visuals and the fact that I understand these types of games are practically their own genre. I should‚Äôve known it was this type of game before I purchased it.
